title: The category of (unital) rings
content: The "category of unital rings" ` RingCat ` is the category of all (unital) rings ` Ring ` in a universe and (unital) ring homomorphisms ` RingHom ` between these rings. This category is defined as "category restriction" of the category of extensible structures ` ExtStrCat `, which restricts the objects to (unital) rings and the morphisms to the (unital) ring homomorphisms, while the composition of morphisms is preserved, see ~ df-ringc . Alternately, the category of unital rings could have been defined as extensible structure consisting of three components/slots for the objects, morphisms and composition, see ~ dfringc2 . In the following, we omit the predicate "unital", so that "ring" and "ring homomorphism" (without predicate) always mean "unital ring" and "unital ring homomorphism". Since we consider only "small categories" (i.e., categories whose objects and morphisms are actually sets and not proper classes), the objects of the category (i.e. the base set of the category regarded as extensible structure) are a subset of the rings (relativized to a subset or "universe" ` u `) ` ( u i^i Ring ) `, see ~ ringcbas , and the morphisms/arrows are the ring homomorphisms restricted to this subset of the rings ` ( RingHom |`` ( B X. B ) ) `, see ~ ringchomfval , whereas the composition is the ordinary composition of functions, see ~ ringccofval and ~ ringcco . By showing that the ring homomorphisms between rings are a subcategory subset (` C_cat `) of the mappings between base sets of extensible structures, see ~ rhmsscmap , it can be shown that the ring homomorphisms between rings are a subcategory (` Subcat `) of the category of extensible structures, see ~ rhmsubcsetc . It follows that the category of rings ` RingCat ` is actually a category, see ~ ringccat with the identity function as identity arrow, see ~ ringcid . Furthermore, it is shown that the ring homomorphisms between rings are a subcategory subset of the non-unital ring homomorphisms between non-unital rings, see ~ rhmsscrnghm , and that the ring homomorphisms between rings are a subcategory of the category of non-unital rings, see ~ rhmsubcrngc . By this, the restriction of the category of non-unital rings to the set of unital ring homomorphisms _is_ the category of unital rings, see ~ rngcresringcat : ` ( ( RngCat `` U ) |``cat ( RingHom |`` ( B X. B ) ) ) = ( RingCat `` U ) ) `. Finally, it is shown that the "natural forgetful functor" from the category of rings into the category of sets is the function which sends each ring to its underlying set (base set) and the morphisms (ring homomorphisms) to mappings of the corresponding base sets, see ~ funcringcsetc .

df-ringc
blocks.content: Definition of the category Ring, relativized to a subset ` u ` . See also the note in [Lang] p. 91, and the item Rng in [Adamek] p. 478. This is the category of all unital rings in ` u ` and homomorphisms between these rings. Generally, we will take ` u ` to be a weak universe or Grothendieck universe, because these sets have closure properties as good as the real thing. (Contributed by AV, 13-Feb-2020.) (Revised by AV, 8-Mar-2020.)

  df-ringc(hs0)
  oveq12d(cfv(cestrc, cv(hs0)), cresc, cres(crh, cxp(cin(cv(hs0), crg), cin(cv(hs0), crg))), cfv(cestrc, c1), c2, wa(w0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1)))

  fveq2(cv(hs0), c1, cestrc)
  eqtrd(cres(crh, cxp(cin(cv(hs0), crg), cin(cv(hs0), crg))), c2, cres(crh, cxp(c4, c4)), wa(w0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1)))
  reseq2d(crh, cxp(cin(cv(hs0), crg), cin(cv(hs0), crg)), cxp(c4, c4), wa(w0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1)))
  sylan9eqr(cxp(cin(cv(hs0), crg), cin(cv(hs0), crg)), cxp(c4, c4), cxp(cin(c1, crg), cin(c1, crg)), w0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1))
  sqxpeqd(cin(cv(hs0), crg), cin(c1, crg), wceq(cv(hs0), c1))
  ineq1(cv(hs0), c1, crg)
  eqcomd(cxp(cin(c1, crg), cin(c1, crg)), cxp(c4, c4), w0)
  sqxpeqd(c4, cin(c1, crg), w0)

  diff.hs0.w(w0)

blocks.name: rhmsscmap2
blocks.content: The unital ring homomorphisms between unital rings (in a universe) are a subcategory subset of the mappings between base sets of unital rings (in the same universe). (Contributed by AV, 6-Mar-2020.)

blocks.name: rhmsscmap
blocks.content: The unital ring homomorphisms between unital rings (in a universe) are a subcategory subset of the mappings between base sets of extensible structures (in the same universe). (Contributed by AV, 9-Mar-2020.)

  reseq2d(crh, ((Base `(RingCat ` c3))√ó(Base `(RingCat ` c3))), (c0 √ó c0), w0)
  sqxpeqd((Base `(RingCat ` c3)), c0, w0)
  eqtrd((Base `(RingCat ` c3)), c0, (c3 ‚ãÇ Ring), w0)
  eqcomd((c3 ‚ãÇ Ring), c0, w0)
  ringchom(s0, (Hom `(RingCat ` c3)), s0, (RingCat ` c3), c3, (Base `(RingCat ` c3)), c4, (w0 ‚àß s0 ‚àà c0))

blocks.name: rhmsubcsetc
blocks.content: The unital ring homomorphisms between unital rings (in a universe) are a subcategory of the category of extensible structures. (Contributed by AV, 9-Mar-2020.)

blocks.name: ringccat
blocks.content: The category of unital rings is a category. (Contributed by AV, 14-Feb-2020.) (Revised by AV, 9-Mar-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm ringccat(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, ccat))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cringc, c0))
} = {
  eqeltrd(c2, ccat, co(cfv(cestrc, c0), cresc, cres(crh, cxp(cin(c0, crg), cin(c0, crg)))), wcel(c0, c1))
  ringcval(c2, c0, cres(crh, cxp(cin(c0, crg), cin(c0, crg))), c1, cin(c0, crg), wcel(c0, c1))
  eqidd(cin(c0, crg), wcel(c0, c1))
  eqidd(cres(crh, cxp(cin(c0, crg), cin(c0, crg))), wcel(c0, c1))
  subccat(co(cfv(cestrc, c0), cresc, cres(crh, cxp(cin(c0, crg), cin(c0, crg)))), cfv(cestrc, c0), cres(crh, cxp(cin(c0, crg), cin(c0, crg))), wcel(c0, c1))
  eqid(co(cfv(cestrc, c0), cresc, cres(crh, cxp(cin(c0, crg), cin(c0, crg)))))
  rhmsubcsetc(cres(crh, cxp(cin(c0, crg), cin(c0, crg))), cfv(cestrc, c0), c0, c1, cin(crg, c0), wcel(c0, c1))
  eqid(cfv(cestrc, c0))
  id(wcel(c0, c1))
  eqidd(cin(crg, c0), wcel(c0, c1))
  reseq2d(crh, cxp(cin(c0, crg), cin(c0, crg)), cxp(cin(crg, c0), cin(crg, c0)), wcel(c0, c1))
  sqxpeqd(cin(c0, crg), cin(crg, c0), wcel(c0, c1))
  a1i(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cin(c0, crg), cin(crg, c0)))
  incom(c0, crg)
}

blocks.content: The identity arrow in the category of unital rings is the identity function. (Contributed by AV, 14-Feb-2020.) (Revised by AV, 10-Mar-2020.)

  eqid(co(cfv(cestrc, c4), cresc, cres(crh, cxp(cin(c4, crg), cin(c4, crg)))))
  rhmsubcsetc(cres(crh, cxp(cin(c4, crg), cin(c4, crg))), cfv(cestrc, c4), c4, c6, cin(c4, crg), w0)

blocks.name: rhmsubcrngc
blocks.content: The unital ring homomorphisms between unital rings (in a universe) are a subcategory of the category of non-unital rings. (Contributed by AV, 12-Mar-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm rhmsubcrngc(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(csubc, c1)))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(crngc, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c4, cin(crg, c2)))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c0, cres(crh, cxp(c4, c4))))
} = {
  mpbir2and(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(csubc, c1)), wbr(c0, cssc, cfv(chomf, c1)), wral(hs0, c4, wa(wcel(cfv(cfv(ccid, c1), cv(hs0)), co(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs0))), wral(hs3, c4, wral(hs4, c4, wral(hs2, co(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs3)), wral(hs1, co(cv(hs3), c0, cv(hs4)), wcel(co(cv(hs1), co(cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs3)), cfv(cco, c1), cv(hs4)), cv(hs2)), co(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs4))))))))))
  3brtr4d(c0, cssc, cfv(chomf, c1), cres(crh, cxp(c4, c4)), cres(crngh, cxp(cfv(cbs, c1), cfv(cbs, c1))), w0)
  breqtrrd(cres(crh, cxp(c4, c4)), cssc, cres(crngh, cxp(cfv(cbs, c1), cfv(cbs, c1))), cres(crngh, cxp(cfv(cbs, cfv(crngc, c2)), cfv(cbs, cfv(crngc, c2)))), w0)
  rhmsscrnghm(c4, cfv(cbs, cfv(crngc, c2)), c2, c3, w0)
  syl6eq(cfv(cbs, cfv(crngc, c2)), cin(crng, c2), cin(c2, crng), w0)
  rngcbas(cfv(cbs, cfv(crngc, c2)), c2, cfv(crngc, c2), c3, w0)
  eqid(cfv(crngc, c2))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, cfv(crngc, c2)))
  incom(c2, crng)
  reseq2d(crngh, cxp(cfv(cbs, c1), cfv(cbs, c1)), cxp(cfv(cbs, cfv(crngc, c2)), cfv(cbs, cfv(crngc, c2))), w0)
  sqxpeqd(cfv(cbs, c1), cfv(cbs, cfv(crngc, c2)), w0)

blocks.name: ringciso
blocks.content: An isomorphism in the category of unital rings is a bijection. (Contributed by AV, 14-Feb-2020.)

thm ringciso(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {

  -| wceq(c2, cfv(ciso, c4))
} = {
  bitrd(w0, wcel(c0, co(c1, c2, c3)), wcel(c0, co(c1, crs, c3)), wcel(c0, cdm(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3))))

  impbid(w0, wcel(c0, cdm(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3))), wcel(c0, co(c1, crs, c3)))
  sylbid(w0, wcel(c0, cdm(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3))), wcel(c0, co(c1, crs, c3)), wbr(c0, co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3), cfv(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3), c0)))
  syl(w0, wb(wcel(c0, cdm(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3))), wbr(c0, co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3), cfv(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3), c0))), wfun(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3)))
  funfvbrb(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3), c0)
  syl6bi(w0, wbr(c0, co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3), cfv(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3), c0)), wcel(c0, co(c1, crs, c3)), wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, crs, c3)), wceq(cfv(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3), c0), ccnv(c0))))
  ringcinv(c0, c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3, cfv(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3), c0), c4, c5, c6, c7, w0)
  simpl(wcel(c0, co(c1, crs, c3)), wceq(cfv(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3), c0), ccnv(c0)))
  mpan2i(w0, wcel(c0, co(c1, crs, c3)), wcel(c0, cdm(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3))), wceq(ccnv(c0), ccnv(c0)))
  eqid(ccnv(c0))
  sylbird(w0, wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, crs, c3)), wceq(ccnv(c0), ccnv(c0))), wcel(c0, cdm(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3))), wbr(c0, co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3), ccnv(c0)))
  ringcinv(c0, c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3, ccnv(c0), c4, c5, c6, c7, w0)
  syl(w0, wi(wbr(c0, co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3), ccnv(c0)), wcel(c0, cdm(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3)))), wrel(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3)))

  syl(w0, wcel(c4, ccat), wcel(c5, c7))
  ringccat(c5, c7, c4)
  funrel(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3))

blocks.name: ringcbasbas
blocks.content: An element of the base set of the base set of the category of unital rings (i.e. the base set of a ring) belongs to the considered weak universe. (Contributed by AV, 15-Feb-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm ringcbasbas(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wa(w0, wcel(c0, c1)), wcel(cfv(cbs, c0), c2))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cringc, c2))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cwun))
} = {
  imp(w0, wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cfv(cbs, c0), c2))
  sylbid(w0, wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cfv(cbs, c0), c2), wcel(c0, cin(c2, crg)))
  eleq2d(c0, c1, cin(c2, crg), w0)
  ringcbas(c1, c2, c3, cwun, w0)
  com12(w0, wcel(c0, cin(c2, crg)), wcel(cfv(cbs, c0), c2))
  sylbi(wcel(c0, cin(c2, crg)), wi(w0, wcel(cfv(cbs, c0), c2)), wa(wcel(c0, c2), wcel(c0, crg)))
  elin(c0, c2, crg)
  adantr(wcel(c0, c2), wcel(c0, crg), wi(w0, wcel(cfv(cbs, c0), c2)))
  syl11(wcel(c0, c2), w0, wcel(cfv(cbs, c0), c2), wcel(c2, cwun))
  ex(wcel(c2, cwun), wcel(c0, c2), wcel(cfv(cbs, c0), c2))
  wunstr(cbs, c0, c2, nat1, wa(wcel(c2, cwun), wcel(c0, c2)))
  df-base()
  simpl(wcel(c2, cwun), wcel(c0, c2))
  simpr(wcel(c2, cwun), wcel(c0, c2))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm ringcbasbas(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ ((w0 ‚àß c0 ‚àà c1)‚Üí(Base ` c0)‚àà c2)
  ‚ä£ c3 =(RingCat ` c2)
  ‚ä£ c1 =(Base ` c3)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c2 ‚àà WUni)
} = {
  imp(w0, c0 ‚àà c1, (Base ` c0)‚àà c2)
  sylbid(w0, c0 ‚àà c1, (Base ` c0)‚àà c2, c0 ‚àà(c2 ‚ãÇ Ring))
  eleq2d(c0, c1, (c2 ‚ãÇ Ring), w0)
  ringcbas(c1, c2, c3, cwun, w0)
  com12(w0, c0 ‚àà(c2 ‚ãÇ Ring), (Base ` c0)‚àà c2)
  sylbi(c0 ‚àà(c2 ‚ãÇ Ring), (w0 ‚Üí(Base ` c0)‚àà c2), (c0 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c0 ‚àà Ring))
  elin(c0, c2, crg)
  adantr(c0 ‚àà c2, c0 ‚àà Ring, (w0 ‚Üí(Base ` c0)‚àà c2))
  syl11(c0 ‚àà c2, w0, (Base ` c0)‚àà c2, c2 ‚àà WUni)
  ex(c2 ‚àà WUni, c0 ‚àà c2, (Base ` c0)‚àà c2)
  wunstr(cbs, c0, c2, nat1, (c2 ‚àà WUni ‚àß c0 ‚àà c2))
  df-base()
  simpl(c2 ‚àà WUni, c0 ‚àà c2)

}

(Contributed by AV, 16-Feb-2020.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: ringcinvALTV
blocks.content: An inverse in the category of rings is the converse operation. (Contributed by AV, 14-Feb-2020.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: funcringcsetcALTV
blocks.content: The "natural forgetful functor" from the category of rings into the category of sets which sends each ring to its underlying set (base set) and the morphisms (ring homomorphisms) to mappings of the corresponding base sets. (Contributed by AV, 16-Feb-2020.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: zrninitoringc
blocks.content: The zero ring is not an initial object in the category of unital rings (if the universe contains at least one unital ring different from the zero ring). (Contributed by AV, 18-Apr-2020.)

blocks.name: nzerooringczr
blocks.content: There is no zero object in the category of unital rings (at least in a universe which contains the zero ring and the ring of integers). Example 7.9 (3) in [Adamek] p. 103. (Contributed by AV, 18-Apr-2020.)
